moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 c5 4. d5 Bd6 5: e5 was better but not disastrously so
moves.13... gxh4 14. e5 Bxe5 15. Nxe5 d6 16. N: This is where you lost your lead. Best move was Nd4. hxg2 is not a problem as a black pawn blocking teh g-file is evn better than a white one. Plus if you bet a back rank check you can escaoe with a capture.
moves.19... Nbd7 20. Rd1: Re1 putting it behind the Q so the Q can go to f4 gathering forces on the K-side
moves.20... Ng4 21. Qd4: puts the Q in a bad place. Your attack is on the K-side. better is Qf4
moves.21... Nge5 22. Nxe5: Nh4 you needed that N for the K-side attack (are you getting the idea yet that your attack should be K-side? ) :O)
moves.22... Nxe5 23. Qe4 f5 24. Qe3: Qf4 attacking the h-pawn and preventing the advance of the f-pawn
moves.24... Bd7 25. Rd4: Game losing move. Just setting yourself up for the N attacks which follow. Putting Q & R together on the same colour square is just begging for a N fork. correct move was b3
moves.25... b4 26. Ne2 Re8 27. Rd2: Cutting off the Q's only escape route
moves.27... f4 28. gxf4 Qg7+ 29. Ng3: The Q is alrea dy lost so Qg3 invites the exchange of your now useless Q for the principal piece in my attack.
